title: PR maven Roxy Jacenko posts video of female jogger repeatedly DEFECATING outside her office
text:
Roxy Jacenko has shared shocking videos showing a female jogger defecating outside her Sweaty Betty PR Sydney office in broad daylight.

The PR maven posted clips of a woman running behind a car on Watson Street in Paddington, pulling down her pants and relieving herself on two occasions.

Separate videos show the jogger defecating in public during her early morning run last Thursday, and again just after 6am on Monday morning.

Furious with the young woman's behaviour, Ms Jacenko told Daily Mail Australia she has found faeces on the street for three weeks.

The PR maven shared videos of a woman running behind a car on Watson Street in Paddington, pulling down her pants and relieving herself on two occasions (pictured)

Roxy Jacenko (pictured) has shared videos of a woman relieving herself outside her Sweaty Betty PR office in Paddington

'It's disgusting, it's a lovely street lined with heritage terraces, kids playing and riding their bikes. Human faeces shouldn't be on any street,' she said.

'Something needs to be done.'

The 39-year-old celebrity publicist is determined to find the culprit, taking to Instagram to get public assistance.

'What an absolute disgrace you are, doing this in our residential street where we have a primary school and multiple residences,' she wrote to her Instagram followers on Monday night.

'This isn't the first visit by the said female jogger. Do you know who this person is?'

In another video taken on Monday morning, the jogger is seen once again crouching behind a car and relieving herself.

'And again - today same lady again. What has the world come to?' Ms Jacenko wrote.

While the third video does not show the woman defecating, it is a clear shot of her running down the street, wearing navy running tights and a lavender top.

'The perpetrator. If you have any information on who this person is please contact us,' the PR maven wrote.

Roxy Jacenko has shared shocking videos of a female jogger defecating outside her Sydney office in broad daylight

Videos show the jogger desperately running and crouching behind a car to relieve herself (pictured)

Ms Jacenko said there have already been several messages alluding to who the woman may be, and more than 4,500 comments on the videos.

When asked if she is going to take the matter further, Ms Jacenko said: 'The neighbours and I will all discuss it and make a decision.'

'The fact is no one should have to walk through or past human faeces to enter their home or place of work.'

'We will be hosing away today's mess tomorrow... I think I would hose her given the chance!'

A neighbouring resident, who wished to remain anonymous, told AAP that there had been four or five human stools in the same spot over the past three weeks.

'One is fair enough if you're caught short - but four or five I think is too much,' the resident said.

'The poos have come more consistently recently. But I hope the woman isn't shamed as she could possibly have a medical condition.'

A NSW Police spokeswoman said the force was aware of the 'circumstances' but had not yet received an official complaint.

In another video taken on Monday morning, the jogger is seen once again crouching behind a car and relieving herself

While the third video does not show the woman defecating, it is a clear shot of her running down the street, wearing navy running tights and a lavender top

Hundreds of Ms Jacenko's followers were disgusted by the jogger's actions.

'Oh my god I don't know whether to laugh or shout in horror,' one Instagram user wrote.

'Think she needs to lay off the pre-workout and protein shakes,' another person said.

Defecating in public is a type of offensive conduct in New South Wales and carries a maximum penalty of 3-month imprisonment and/or a $660 fine.

Someone who commits offensive conduct in NSW can also be issued with an on-the-spot fine of $500 by a police officer.

While the behaviour shocks many, it isn't the first time someone has taken to public streets to defecate.

In May last year, Brisbane residents complained after a morning runner had relieved himself on a public pathway leading to an apartment block for over a year.

Residents of the unit block came together to find the culprit, with a photographer waiting outside to catch him in the middle of his morning ritual.

The bizarre operation lead to the arrest of 64-year-old Andrew Macintosh who was caught defecating at least 30 times within a year.
description: PR Maven Roxy Jacenko shared videos of a woman running behind a car in Paddington, Sydney, pulling down her pants and defecating in broad daylight.
authors: Lauren Ferri For Daily Mail Australia
